p: We confirmed the earlier observed relative ease of formation of α-SiB 3– x . It appears that the particle size of Si is an important parameter in this respect, as reactions with nano-Si could be performed at unprecedented low temperatures (1150 °C). Using nano-Si, we find that the optimum T, t conditions for achieving roentgenographically pure samples of α-SiB 3– x is sintering at 1225 °C for 16 h (referring to tightly pressed pellets with ratio 1:3 of the starting materials specified). We also mention that it is possible to exploit the comparatively fast kinetics of α-SiB 3– x formation for the simultaneous synthesis and consolidation of α-SiB 3– x specimens in a spark plasma sintering device and refer for further details to Supporting Information ( Figure S12).
